drupalNodeEvent.title: Studying Maltreatment Through Polyvictimization: Evidence from the Salar Ethnic Group in Qinghai, China

field_speakers.processed: Clifton R. Emery, Associate Professor of Social Work and Social Administration, The University of Hong Kong

field_organizers.processed: Weatherhead East Asian Institute at Columbia University

field_description.processed:
This lecture uses in-depth river of life oral history data collected from 200 Salar mothers in Qinghai, China to study the invasiveness, exploitativeness, and severity of victimization among children.

This event is part of the 2022-2023 lecture series on “Urbanization, Well-being, and Public Policy: China from Comparative Perspectives” and is sponsored by the Weatherhead East Asian Institute and cosponsored by Columbia's China Center for Social Policy.
